objective:
Objective:

Learn how to make popups (like Dialogs) more accessible by ensuring that each dialog has a proper label using the ariaLabelledBy.
task:
Task:

You are given a Dialog with content but no accessible name.

Set up a title and an accessible label using the ariaLabelledBy attribute, ensuring that screen readers can render the dialog accessible name and title when it opens.
instruction:
Instruction:

In the file /webapp/exercises/Exercise12.fragment.xml add the ariaLabelledBy property in the Dialog control.
howToTest:
How to test:

  • Use NVDA (Screen Reader) to inspect the Dialog. It should vocalize its title.
helpCode:
<Dialog
  id="idExercise12Dialog"
  title="Product"
  //Take a look at ariaLabelledBy association for sap.m.Dialog control
  class="sapUiResponsivePadding--content sapUiResponsivePadding--header"
>
  <content>
    <Text
      id="idNotebookExercise12DialogText"
      text="{i18n>Exercise12.fragment.dialog.text}"
    />
  </content>
